title: Mobile-Based e-Portfolio and Social Network-Enhanced Science Learning Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science knowledge and fundamental smartphone usage skills
context.additional_context: Self-directed science learning program in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Targets job seekers and adult learners, providing mobile-optimized materials and activities

learning_goals: Learners can build and manage e-portfolios in mobile environments

In university social network platforms (e.g., LMS discussion boards, Padlet), learners can exchange peer feedback ≥twice during three science inquiry projects, document feedback implementation in one improvement report, and submit it.

Over an 18-week learning process, learners can record weekly scientific problem-solving steps (problem definition, hypothesis, experiment design, analysis, conclusion) in an e-portfolio, incorporate ≥three peer feedback iterations, and finalize the portfolio.
Learners show a 20% or greater improvement in academic achievement and learning engagement through e-portfolio-based learning activities

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
